pain_points_original.title: Meeting PROTECTED Level Security Mandates
pain_points_original.description: The solution must be independently certified through the IRAP process to the PROTECTED security level. This is a non-negotiable Australian Government requirement for handling sensitive legal information. Failure to meet this standard is an absolute disqualifier for working with the AGD.

pain_points_original.title: Ensuring Australian Data Sovereignty
pain_points_original.description: All customer data must be stored and processed exclusively within Australia, with privileged actions performed only from Australian locations. This is a strict legal and policy requirement to prevent foreign access and maintain national control over sensitive government legal data.

pain_points_original.title: AI Explainability and Ethical Risk Mitigation
pain_points_original.description: Any AI usage must be ethical, transparent, and explainable, allowing AGS to understand and justify how the AI reached its conclusions. Opaque 'black box' AI presents an unacceptable legal and reputational risk for a central government legal provider whose advice must be defensible.

pain_points_original.title: Strict Compliance with Australian Privacy Law
pain_points_original.description: The solution must demonstrate full compliance with the Australian Privacy Principles (APPs) under the Privacy Act 1988. As a government entity, handling client and personal information without meeting this legal standard creates significant legal, financial, and reputational risk.

pain_points_original.title: Low Productivity in Core Legal Workflows
pain_points_original.description: Current manual workflows are hindering the efficiency of approximately 570 lawyers across 40 practice areas. AGS seeks to improve productivity by augmenting time-consuming tasks like drafting, summarising evidence, and discovery, freeing up lawyers for high-value strategic work.

pain_points_original.title: Seamless Integration with Core Systems
pain_points_original.description: The AI tool must integrate with existing critical systems, including iManage Cloud, Elite 3E, and Microsoft Office, as it is meant to supplement, not replace, them. Poor integration would create fragmented workflows, reduce adoption, and negate potential productivity benefits.

pain_points_original.title: Need for Australian-Specific Legal AI
pain_points_original.description: AGS requires AI tools specifically designed for Australian legal practices. Generic international tools are insufficient as they lack understanding of local laws, precedents, and terminology, which would produce inaccurate and unreliable outputs for government legal work.

pain_points_original.title: Future-Proofing with Advanced Agentic AI
pain_points_original.description: AGS is looking beyond standard generative AI towards emerging agentic AI systems capable of autonomous, multi-step task execution. This reflects a strategic need to invest in a forward-looking platform that can evolve, rather than a point solution that will quickly become obsolete.

pain_points_original.title: Ineffective Knowledge and Document Discovery
pain_points_original.description: Lawyers face challenges with inefficient discovery, including identifying relevant documents in large data sets and finding key themes across legal texts. This consumes valuable time, increases the risk of missing critical facts, and drives up costs for government clients.
